reason: Standalone marketplace blueprint never imported nor registered in app bootstrap.
impact: Duplicate UI and checkout flows risk diverging from active marketplace routes.
risk: Low runtime risk (dead code) but medium coordination to confirm no external references.
next_steps: Confirm with product/QA that no environment mounts the legacy blueprint.
Archive or delete module after creating documentation snapshot.
Consolidate tests to cover marketplace/routes.py only.

reason: Webhook blueprint not registered; Mercado Pago integration moved to marketplace/routes.py.
impact: Confusing entry point for payment notifications; potential misconfiguration of webhook URL.
risk: Low (unused) but ensure no cron/script imports it directly.
next_steps: Search deployments for direct imports of marketplace_payments.
If unused, delete and update documentation to reference marketplace/routes.py endpoints.
If needed, rewire blueprint under payments namespace.

reason: Older marketplace blueprint duplicates supplier routes and is not registered in app.py.
impact: Developers may patch wrong file; increases bug surface when adjusting supplier flows.
risk: Medium – confirm no imports from background jobs.
next_steps: Verify git history for last active usage and check staging configs.
Remove or merge logic into market.py/marketplace.routes.
Add regression tests around active blueprint before deletion.

reason: Historic entry point no longer referenced by tooling; retains deprecated `db.create_all` flow.
impact: Confuses newcomers and risks accidental use with outdated configuration.
risk: Low – ensure no cron/supervisor job points to it.
next_steps: Confirm deployment scripts reference app.py only.
Remove app_old.py and related docs after approval.
Add guardrail in README linking to current bootstrap.

reason: Service modules lack inbound imports from blueprints per static analysis.
impact: May represent dead background features or scheduled jobs; dead code complicates dependency audits.
risk: Unknown – validate with ops before removal.
next_steps: Confirm whether Celery/background workers import these modules.
If unused, remove dependencies from requirements and delete modules.
Otherwise, document owning blueprint or job with tests.
